The '''Galaxy Nexus''' is a [[touchscreen]] [[slate phone|slate]] [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[smartphone]] developed by a partnership of [[Samsung]] and [[Google]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the third generation successor to Googleâs previous flagship phones, the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]]. It has an entirely new design and includes a host of hardware and software upgrades including a curved HD (1280Ã720 pixels)<ref>[http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_nexus-4219.php Samsung Galaxy Nexus â Full phone specifications]. Gsmarena.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref> Super [[AMOLED]] display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system, version 4.0, codenamed ''Ice Cream Sandwich''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref> Before the official announcement, it was referred to as the Google Nexus Prime among Android enthusiasts. The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between the ''Samsung Galaxy'' and ''[[Google Nexus]]'' brands of Android smartphones.
The '''Galaxy Nexus''' is a [[touchscreen]] [[slate phone|slate]] [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[smartphone]] developed by a partnership of [[Samsung]] and [[Google]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/samsung-and-google-introduce-galaxy-nexus-2011-10-18|title=Samsung and Google introduce GALAXY Nexus|publisher=[[MarketWatch]]|date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> The phone and operating system were developed collaboratively by engineers from both companies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9220984/Samsung_Google_unveil_latest_Android_OS_phone|title=Samsung, Google unveil latest Android OS, phone|publisher=''[[Computerworld]]''|date=October 19, 2011|accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It is the third generation successor to Googleâs previous flagship phones, the [[Nexus One]] and [[Nexus S]]. It has an entirely new design and includes a host of hardware and software upgrades including a curved HD (1280Ã720 pixels)<ref>[http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_nexus-4219.php Samsung Galaxy Nexus â Full phone specifications]. Gsmarena.com. Retrieved on 2011-11-21.</ref> Super [[AMOLED]] display, an improved camera system, and Googleâs new version of its Android operating system, version 4.0, codenamed ''Ice Cream Sandwich''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsungs-galaxy-nexus-gets-official-android-4-0-4-65-inch-hd|title=Samsung's Galaxy Nexus gets official: Android 4.0, 4.65-inch HD Super AMOLED display (video)|publisher=[[Engadget]]|date=October 18, 2011}}</ref> Before the official announcement, it was referred to as the Google Nexus Prime among Android enthusiasts. The name is the result of [[co-branding]] between the ''Samsung Galaxy'' and ''[[Google Nexus]]'' brands of Android smartphones.
â
The Galaxy Nexus was unveiled at Google and Samsung's ''Ice Cream Sandwich'' event on 19 October, 2011 in [[Hong Kong]]. It was released on November, 17, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display|title=This Is the Samsung Galaxy Nexus, Googleâs New Official Android Phone|work=Gizmodo}}</ref> Amazon UK has confirmed they will be selling the Galaxy Nexus starting on December 2, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.co.uk/Samsung-Galaxy-Nexus-16GB-Smartphone/dp/B005XYU45E|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus 16GB Sim Free Smartphone|work=Amazon.com}}</ref>
+
The Galaxy Nexus was unveiled at Google and Samsung's ''Ice Cream Sandwich'' event on 19 October, 2011 in [[Hong Kong]]. It was released on November, 17, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display|title=This Is the Samsung Galaxy Nexus, Googleâs New Official Android Phone|work=Gizmodo}}</ref> [[Amazon.com|Amazon UK]] has confirmed they will be selling the Galaxy Nexus starting on December 2, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.co.uk/Samsung-Galaxy-Nexus-16GB-Smartphone/dp/B005XYU45E|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus 16GB Sim Free Smartphone|work=Amazon.com}}</ref>
